definition: to shed/to take off/to escape/to get away from

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: The glider uncoupled from the two planes.
But Matthew pulled away from Hattie with an easy grin.
sentences.chinese: 但是马修轻松地笑着，从海蒂那儿脱开身。

sentences.english: Let the constraints , set you free.
sentences.chinese: 让束缚脱开枷锁，释放创意。

sentences.english: Like an autumn cicada sloughing off its skin.
sentences.chinese: 像秋蝉把它的皮壳脱开。

sentences.english: Use a special tool to disengage them.
sentences.chinese: 使用一个专门工具来把它们脱开。

sentences.english: Disconnect the generator from the prime mover.
sentences.chinese: 将发电机与原动机脱开。

sentences.english: The hind wheel of it was shot down. And its door was off the hinges.
sentences.chinese: 它的后轮被击落，而且它的门也跟合页脱开了。

sentences.english: The wing of the plan broke away in mid-air and the plane crashed.
sentences.chinese: 飞机的一翼在半空中脱开了，飞机也随之坠毁。

sentences.english: The phenomena of separation, reclosing and sliding occur between pile foundation and soil.
sentences.chinese: 桩基与土体间发生了脱开再闭合和滑移现象。

sentences.english: Disengage the gears when you park the car.
sentences.chinese: 停车时应该把排档脱开。

sentences.english: She never seem to fear that I will withdraw her hand.
sentences.chinese: 她似乎从来不担心我会脱开她的手。

sentences.english: The wing of the plane broke off in mid - air and the plane crashed.
sentences.chinese: 飞机的一翼在半空中脱开了，飞机也随之坠毁。

definition: to throw off/to struggle free of/Taiwan pr. [zheng1 tuo1]
to break away/to extricate/to escape/to leave the confines of
to release/to let go/to loosen/to untie/to come loose
to detain/to hold back by force/to buckle/to hook
to relinquish one's grip/to let go
to fasten tightly with a hoop
with all one's might/with sudden force/violently/to slam
to pull apart/to pry open with the hands
to shake/to fling one's arm/to lash/to swing
